website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a high-quality coffee maker to go with your top-of-the-line grinder, give this 2-in-1 machine a try. Brewing coffee immediately after grinding captures the bean's freshness and essential oils.
pros: Choice of 8 strength settings or option to use pre-ground coffee
Half-pound hopper has locking system that makes removal, storage and transfer easy
Brewing options for single cup to 12-cup carafe
Removable drip tray with clearance for tall cups and travel mugs
cons: You cannot use distilled water, water processed with reverse osmosis or any other demineralized water with this machine
Its sensors require mineral content to operate properly

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful beast that needs a lot of TLC
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this coffee maker so bad but we just could not get it to work properly. It pulled in way too many beans each grind (regardless of the setting), and it didn’t grind them all. It kept clogging and we ended up with muddy, gritty coffee. We ended up sending this beautiful beast back and didn’t have any issues with a refund. I have since read that ‘dry’ beans are a must for this machine as oily ones can cause a lot of issues. I wish they sold one without the grinder because other than ours not working properly, the built-in grinder required a lot of regular cleaning - and there are a lot of parts.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Swanstrom-Moore

customer_reviews.title: Loved the brand but not the performance of this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Coffee didn't stay hot for as long as we expected. Grounds sprayed all over - a mess.. It just seemed to be more trouble than our Cuisinart it replaced. we returned it in less than 1 month. Amazon gave us a full refund which we were thrilled about. This is the first Breville we have ever had a problem with. We love the Breville products and that is why we bought it. It had a coffee bean grinder which we never used.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Like others have stated, at first I thought this all in one coffee maker was the most awesome product invented. Coffee was awesome, hot and consistent every time. That changed after about 6 months when it started producing watery coffee. The grinder is this machines downfall. They need to go back to the drawing board because the concept of this machine is great. I still use it but have a separate burr grinder and just use the pre-ground setting. For what I paid for this thing I'm using it until it's completely dead. My advice is to keep looking. Too many people have had this issue and Breville isn't any help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I gotta return this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I gotta return this thing. The coffee tastes like plastic. It's really gross. I've done over 10 water flushes and two flushes with vinegar. I've thoroughly wiped and cleaned this thing. Used different types of water. The plastic smell from the water tank and in the coffee always returns. It also burns through coffee beans. It's disappointing and laughable because it costs so much. I really wanted to love it. Mainly got it because I wanted something to make me coffee in the morning and force me out of bed. Looking for a machine with a decent burr and easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Baba Yaga

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My friends call me a coffee snob. This is because I seek out the best brewer for quality and flavour. This brewer is the best ever. There is no brewer with grinder that can compare. Easy to set up and use. No hassle cleaning. A moderately quiet grinder. I have tried just about all the grinder/brewers out there and this is simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick P. Ours

customer_reviews.title: Very poor performance....weak watery coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Breville Grind Control for 4 years and love it. HOWEVER, I just ordered a second one for another residence and is clearly an new model which doesn’t work at all. I am very familiar with all the ways to adjust the machine for grind size etc but this new machine makes ONLY watery coffee. It’s obviously a new (very inferior) model. In my opiniion it should be RECALLED.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M. Burden

customer_reviews.title: Product was given as a special anniversary gift to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was given as a special anniversary gift to my parents who tried to use it for eight days, and then returned it. The grinding feature either reduced the coffee to dust or did a very rough grind. Unit over all was apparently difficult to clean out / clean up. Coffee made was never hotter than lukewarm and my parents found it to be quite weak. The hyper-insulated carafe is apparently constructed in such a way that when you pour out the last bit, most of it spills outside of the cup you are trying to pour into. My parents were directly in touch with Breville for advice on more than one occasion, watched tutorials online, but eventually gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Clean, really poorly thought out design.  Skip
customer_reviews.text: Trying to keep this short. When it works, it makes good coffee. However: 1. Hopper design is bad. You have to bump it to get the beans to feed if it isn't 100% full 2. Proper cleaning of the grinder area would require a vacuum, or turning the entire unit upside down. 3. The grounds are blown SIDEWAYS into the basket, rather than falling. As a result, the grounds stick to the opening, and eventually clog the whole thing... get cooked on by steam, and take a screw driver to remove. Really just not worth the price. I'd return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the worst choices we could have made, especially considering how overpriced this was. The coffee is barely hot 10-15 minutes after it brews. It has no burner to help keep the carafe hot. You cannot clean the carafe, let alone pour out the last cup because the hole on the top is so small. Taking the grinder portion apart to clean is quite the process and you have to do it frequently or it clogs up and won't dispense the grinds into the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre coffee maker, Grind Control fails to calibrate.
customer_reviews.text: Two problems, (1) The brew time is shorter than eight minutes and cannot be adjusted, (2) The Grind Control does not Calibrate, I have tried no less than 20 times to set that grinder to output 25mg or coffee grounds and it failed every single time. It only seems to modulate between 13-15mg which doesnt make a great pot of coffee. I now skip the grind control and use pre-ground but the brew time is too short as mentioned previously.
customer_reviews.author: Gajit hown

customer_reviews.title: Breville BDC650BSS Delivered to me USED
customer_reviews.text: Machine has been delivered on the 11-17-17 and I have not been refunded yet! Coffee machine was delivered used with beans inside compartment. Coffee and finger print stains all over the machine. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mojimx

customer_reviews.title: Get ready for some good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Most everything about this product is great. Having the ability to change most every aspect of the Brewing process is fun to play around with. You can turn a mediocre blend of coffee beans into a very delicious tasting cup of coffee. Only problem I have had is not checking to see if the bean Hopper has enough beans in it before I brew so I have had a couple of instances where I will wake up in the morning to a pot of coffee that only had half the amount of ground beans. So I've had to dump a few pots of half brewed coffee and re brew.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Jan 2017. Learned early on that you cannot trust the grind process to grind enough beans. Must open top and push beans into chute for grinder. I lived with that for 2 yrs and 4 months. But now the machine has totally stopped grinding. No apparent problems. But it does not make coffee from whole beans anymore. For $259.95 you would think this would have worked for at least 5 years. My cheapo promo coffee grind and brew from Melita lasted 14 years and still works but I thought I should get a new one. Back to the old cheapo one.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COST!
customer_reviews.text: My first and last Breville product, back to Cusinart for me! First couple months were fine, then the chute would clog with every brewed pot of coffee. Then just as the worthless warranty ran out, the amount of water would not register so, it WOULD NOT brew coffee. That lasted a week and then started to work again. I’ve cleaned the chute more times than recommended, if every day counts, have cleaned the water tank in accordance with manufacture recommendations and honestly every 2 weeks, not just when prompted. This is a worthless expensive piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Messy and Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee when it operates correctly. I keep it clean but the grinder has jammed up once already. On several occasions, for whatever reason, it spills coffee grounds onto the top of the filter holder and down onto everything else. That means you not only have a message, but that the pot of coffee just finished will be basically nothing but hot water. I would not buy this machine again. Too much trouble just to make a cup or pot of coffee. Breville's other products have worked well for me except this one. I recommend a separate grinder. I will continue to use this pot but with already ground coffee until I can get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I decided to upgrade to this and I really don't like it at all
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart grind and brew for about 10 years that finally died. I decided to upgrade to this and I really don't like it at all. I have to set the strength to 8 and the grind setting to coarse to just get moderately strong coffee as grinds get stuck in the shut and not pushed through or stuck to the side and still dry after the brewing process. It could just be that I'm brewing 4 cups at a time since I'm the only coffee drinker. The machine is easier to clean than the Cuisinart, but the mechanical process of mixing the ground coffee with the water is definitely subpar.
customer_reviews.author: kfrost72

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We have not had this coffee maker very long and have found it to be a problem every morning. I have read the booklet over and over and tried everything but cannot seem to get a good cup of coffee. We buy our beans fresh and have tried different beans for flavor so we know it’s not the beans. I’ve set the strength to the highest and adjusted the grind control and still get weak dirty water. I’ve reset this machine and cleaned this machine and nothing works. I don’t enjoy working this hard for a great cup of coffee and getting no results. This is either a flawed design or I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Erlina Pollitt

customer_reviews.title: Too inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I love the grind and brew coffee when it works. The key to getting a good, consistent grind is keeping the grind chute clean. It seems that nobody can come up with an easy way to do this as I’ve used other brands and my second Breville. That said I’m done! I just want a consistent cup of coffee in the morning and not a big cleaning project because this turkey can’t consistently work. So now we’re going to just use it as a traditional preground coffee maker (there is a setting for that)For this price I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pattillo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Update 7/21/2020: Love this coffee maker. Absolutely the best coffee maker I ever purchased. Very easy, and coffee tastes better every morning. It’s expensive for a maker but I’m saving money each day by grinding my own beans, no wasted grinds. 1 month in, and I love my breville coffee maker. Grinds well and coffee taste so much better. I enjoy my coffee now that it’s not bitter. Looks great, makes great coffee, and easy to use. I would say 1 issue would be the carafe. Need to really tilt it to get coffee out. Surprisingly, even when almost tipped over, coffee doesn’t spill. Just weird.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous coffee maker/bean grinder. Makes delicious coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this machine. (We find Breville machines of all types unbeatable.) The one shortcoming with this machine is keeping the rotating disk that admits ground coffee into filter basked clean. The disc gets gummy with melted(?) grounds. The disk is next to impossible to clean without removing it. This is doable, but clearly not intended as a "customer operation". Simply brushing gunk off the disk (as Breville suggest) does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Miranker

customer_reviews.title: Grind Control Better For Single Serve
customer_reviews.text: The machine does a great job grinding beans for Single serve. The coffee tastes great and I'm happy I bought the machine. The down side is it does not have the grind control figured out for a pot. If you choose 8 cup pot with the lowest setting of grind it still grinds WAYYYYYYY too many beans making the coffee almost undrinkable. We always set the setting to 350 ML and grind 4 for Single cup and it makes an outstanding cup of coffee. For the pot, we do single serve grind twice and it works that way. Overall, I'm satisfied, but am left wanting for a better grind control for a whole pot.
customer_reviews.author: jonmichi

customer_reviews.title: Breville makes sturdy, high quality appliances
customer_reviews.text: We loved our Breville food processor because it was so heavy, sturdy and had such quality workmanship. Now we love the Coffee Maker as it is much easier to clean than most grind coffee makers and seems like it will last a long time. The ability to adjust the strength and water is great. We had to learn to remember to put the coffee urn in before pressing start and to not have the coffee all over the floor after warming the metal urn with hot water, lol, but we definitely prefer the metal over glass and it keeps coffee hot for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RiverviewSndy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several days and I love it. I particularly like that you can set it up to start in the morning, very simple to operate, minimal cleaning needed, grinds beans right before brewing which makes a huge difference to preserve flavor. Instead of using the Carafe, I brew directly into my 16-oz Zojirushi mug in the morning to take to work. For me, this has been well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lubna

customer_reviews.title: Grinder broke after less than 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is no longer functional after 20 months of use. I had been having errors off and on but now I can’t seem to fix it. I have to use pre-ground coffee and it still gives me errors but I’m able to get past it by unplugging the coffee maker. Good enough flavor for being a grind and brew if you put it on the max setting. i feel Ike I should have spring fur a Nespresso instead. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: GatorBear

customer_reviews.title: Grinder stopped working in original AND replacement unit in 3-4 months
customer_reviews.text: The original unit stopped grinding (slows down to nothing) after a few days, the replacement unit stopped this morning after little over 3 1/2 months. This does it for Breville in my mind. Back to the search for a company that actually makes quality products that don't require a bank loan for purchase. I didn't like having to break it down and clean it so often either. While I liked some of the features, the poor quality and extra maintenance requirements (as compared to other machines) made this whole experience negative.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harrah

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about it
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the other Grind N Brew coffeemakers. One was so loud it woke us up, another cost more but did not last very long. Replaced 3 times under warranty,. Finally gave up. THIS one, so far, has been a gem. I had a problem within the first few months and called the company. They walked me through the process. I should have read the manual. It worked just like they said in the manual and on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: MerryChristmas

customer_reviews.title: Consistently, makes the best coffee everytime
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Breville. It makes the same quality of coffee, either by the cup or by the pot. It is not maintenance free, but is worthy of the time and care it takes to make an exceptional cup of coffee. Getting a new one, out of the box, it requires calibration and experimenting to get the grind and flavor the way you want. Once that is done, you get the same coffee no matter how much coffee you want.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a month!!!
customer_reviews.text: We got our first Breville back in 2012, so it last over 6 years until we got the dreaded "error" message on the LCD display. That machine made the best coffee! There was a trade off however, it's a bitch to clean. We decided to get the newer model, it made great coffee and was still a bitch to clean. The problem this time is it lasted LESS then a month! We got it from Amazon on Jan. 7th and the grinder stop working on Feb. 3rd. Sorry Breville, 2 strikes and you are out! We will never buy your products again.
customer_reviews.author: ChappyUGA

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, lousy machine
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee, lousy machine. The basket would pop out before finished causing the rest of the coffee not to brew. One time, in the week I had it, the basket opened and I had hot coffee everywhere. You can't get your hand inside the actual carafe to clean it. It's hard to pour as it's not easy to pour it easy enough to empty the pot unless you dump it on its head. But the coffee was good.
customer_reviews.author: LMJB

customer_reviews.title: Prone to Jamming
customer_reviews.text: It makes a good pot of coffee, most of the time. However, it's disappointing that a machine so expensive suffers from significant reliability issues, with grounds accumulating and eventually blocking the discharge chute from the grinder into the brew basket. The result, without any preceding warning signs, is a pot of "coffee" that is nothing but hot water that passed through an empty brew basket, and miserable tedium to chisel the chute clear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Too tall and not hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: Several reviews will say the same thing. I was really looking forward to this device. I own several of their items. I returned this after the first few times of using. It is 17 inches tall. It did not fit under my “Standard” residential counter / cabinet height. I think it is better suited for an office. And. The biggest reason for the return. The coffee would not get hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: AWHarris1970

customer_reviews.title: Coffee perfection
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for quite awhile so this review is with some experience. I absolutely love this coffee maker, not my first grind and brew. Now with any grind and brew, there will be maintenance. Breville has engineered this to make it ultra easy to do, it is a very smart machine, letting you know when stuff needs to be done. You can customize your cup to your prefect and it just keeps doing it great. Just buy this brewer, learn how to maintain it and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M Jenereaux

customer_reviews.title: Hot coffee at the perfect temperature every time.
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 coffee pots in mind as my Cuisinart Grind and Brew 10 cup started leaking like the other 3 I’ve had. It was between another Cuisinart and this. A lot of the negative reviews were due to the maintenance which I am used to. I wish I would have got this coffee lot sooner. The coffee comes out so hot and I can adjust the brew strength to my liking. I run it on 3 for strength and it is perfect every time. The cleaning of this machine is way less than the Cuisinart. By far my favorite coffee pot I’ve ever owned. A+ Breville!!!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan S

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine is a lot of work for an expensive piece of hardware. we used for over 1-month and could not brew an unbitter cup. - the ground bean opening clogged regularly - the carafe never fully empties unless you remove the top and tip the carafe over, which leads to spilled coffee. - the carafe is not see through so you never know how much coffee is in the pot - the coffee did not stay warm in the carafe We are a fan of Breville and have a few items that we really love but this one for me & my family was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: jowee B

customer_reviews.title: best Grind N Brew coffee maker I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned a Cusinart Grind-N-Brew and can say it held up very well for 9 years. After it stopped working, I upgraded to this Breville and it is truly a step up. I love the ability to control more of the brew process with this unit. It may take a layperson a longer time to figure out how to use it and you do want to wipe clean a stainless wheel after each use, but for the connoisseur this is simply an awesome coffee maker that makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works great. Until I did the clean out ( brush ...
customer_reviews.text: once I figured out that you need to clean out the spout from the ginger to the basket every 5 uses, it works great. Until I did the clean out ( brush included--but I also itse the end of a tea spoon) it would not let ground coffee into the brew basket so ---no coffee just pale water.
customer_reviews.author: stan koczka

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous coffee maker! Grinds the beans to perfection and is quieter than the Cuisinart I had previously. One drawback for me is, you cannot use the ground coffee simultaneously with the beans. It has to be one or the other. With my previous coffee maker, I could add some ground decaf &grind the beans I wanted to make my own blend. Not the case with this one. This one is still top notch, though.
customer_reviews.author: EuroShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not For HOT Coffee Lovers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because of the Breville name. On first use, I noticed temperature was not very hot compared to what I get at local coffee house. After three uses, I called Breville for assistance. After a lengthy discussion and troubleshooting suggestions, I learned the coffee should dispense between 190 - 205 degree F. After purchasing a thermometer, I learned the direct pour from coffee machine to cup was only 165 degrees. Machine was returned and replacement received. New machine only reaches 167 degrees after direct pour to cup. Replacement will be returned. Should I try 3 times??
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and always fresh tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: bought it for my friend because she was wanting something more convenient, less expensive to use and NO PODS like her keurig. Her niece has one and swore by it and i grew up on fresh ground coffee so i knew she would love the taste. It looks good, easy to set up to anyone's liking whether its a cup or a pot of coffee you need at that time. thinking of getting another one for the lake cabin
customer_reviews.author: robert ferrero

customer_reviews.title: Significantly improved
customer_reviews.text: I happily used the previous model for several years and modernized after it developed a "now and then" leak. The newer model is much quieter and quicker than the older one. Otherwise this Breville makes the same high quality single cup or carafe coffee. I noticed that there are some complaints about the carafe's ability to keep coffee warm. The machine is not designed to boil away coffee. Preheating the carafe by rinsing with hot water prior to use will help keep a potfull hot for a reasonable amount of time. Cleaning the unit requires some care, but it should be expected of grinder/brewer. "Average" in this case is not a bad score. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fresh coffee with dial-in settings
customer_reviews.text: If fresh ground coffee is what you want, this is the machine. Several different settings to dial in your flavor and strength. The larger carafe (60 oz) is great for having guests over too. The basket is easy enough to clean, but you also need to wipe down the metal disk inside after each use (only complaint). Other than that, it’s been great! Can’t beat the fresh grind!
customer_reviews.author: Blake Wells

customer_reviews.title: Changed Review from 1 to 5. 😇
customer_reviews.text: We loved our coffee maker when we first got it. Exactly 31 days after purchase, the grinder stopped working which pretty much makes this breville an outrageously expensive Mr. Coffee. Really not happy that we can’t return it. HOWEVER, I did something remarkable. I read the manual, found out the problem, which as easily solved by removing a build up of grounds where they enter the basket. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wiener

customer_reviews.title: It Really has a Brain!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. The ”brain” knows how to measure and grind the perfect blend, whether making one cup or a full pot. It is far superior to the Cuisinart we’ve had for over seven years (it died). My only mark against it is that it’s a bit difficult to clean the grind shoot and will have to look for a mini vacuum cleaner to make cleaning it less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: $239 is not inexpensive for a coffee maker. This was purchased specifically for the grind feature which began to have problems after about 8 months. Fought with it, reset it, etc. for another four months or so. Finally just threw it out and bought the Cuisinart with the automatic grind feature. Even if this one only lasts a year as well at least it was $100 less. (Oh and don't buy the purchase plan - their website is a mess and it will take so long to get anything done you'll end up buying a new unit before they can offer to have it sent out for repair).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great machine... when it works!  DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this brewer/grinder is cool but the water sensor keeps going out and renders it useless. Over time the water sensor stops working and once it does not sense water present, it WILL NOT WORK. ...There is no way around it. It is possible that our water has something in it that causes the sensor to fail but it that is the case then buyer beware. This machine is too expensive to fail in less than a year and I would NEVER buy it just because of this alone. Otherwise, it is really a good machine but fatally flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Keys

customer_reviews.title: Great for 60 days....
customer_reviews.text: This was my second of these the first of which I had for 6 years. This one, the grinder went out within 60 days. The programming buttons although easier to use, are also easier to mis use. For some reason I can set it, but then it resets or something. I wake up to one cup instead of one pot. Again, now its just a regular pot as even after an extensive cleaning the grinder doesn't work anymore Amazon offered the payment plan on this and the payments will far outlast the machine! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the previous gen. Model!
customer_reviews.text: We love this updated model even more than the previous generation! The processor chip is even smarter, and has more sensors for grind, brew strength, filling, and cup size. Setting the time of day and start time is easier with the rotating knob vs. buttons on the previous gen. It seems easier to clean, as well- the ground coffee chute does not clog as in previous models, and only requires a quick vacuum out from the top-far faster than the little brush!. Finally- and unusually- it make a wicked strong brew, unlike the past model. Set it to 8, and it will match any pour-over for strength.
customer_reviews.author: m webb

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee pot on the market, I continue to love it every day. I show off all of its cool features when I have company who are also coffee drinkers. They've all said they want one too. EDIT: IT LASTED ONE YEAR AND 13 DAYS. THE COMPANY WOULDN'T DO ANYTHING BECAUSE IT WAS PAST A YEAR. you'd expect when spending that kind of money it would last especially because I cleaned it routinely. Ggggrrrrrrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: The Grind Control is really easy to use and clean, with consistent brewing over time. I especially like the ease of filling up the hopper with beans and just filling the maker with water when you want a pot. Haven't used for a single cup yet, though. I would advise keeping an eye on the bean hopper - it goes through beans faster than I would've thought.
customer_reviews.author: BKW

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this! They make it very easy to brew, once your settings are set, the coffee maker makes the coffee without having to program it everytime and it's very intuitive. The carafe keeps your coffee hot, but without a burner that ends in burnt coffee. There are labels all over the machine telling you what to do. Phenomenal coffee Brewer!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffyjean

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee, Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee maker, and excellent customer service! We've been happy with this coffee maker for about 15 months but it started to malfunction. Breville sent us a label to FEDEX the main body for service or replacement. We received a new (refurbished) unit less than a week later - AT NO COST TO US. Also note, we were 3 months past the 1-year limited warranty. They even included a new thermal pot, which we'd been instructed not to return with the original unit. Overall, very satisfied with the quality of the coffee, the operation of the unit, and and that Breville stands behind it with great service!
customer_reviews.author: Norm Presecan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when you buy this just after 35 days stopped working. My 30day return ended on June 2nd and on June 8th it stopped grinding the beans. Since I’m 6 days past the 30 day return I’m out of luck now I have to go through the manufacture to see if I can get a return or a replacement. Oh and I have to buy another coffee maker since now we don’t have one. Won’t be buying from them.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid coffee maker. It makes great coffee and doesn't make as much noise as most brands with grinders built in. For the quick and quite morning that the new born is sleeping I use the pre ground option as it dones make some noise. As for the strength settings and amount to get a good ratio I had to just mess with it and experiment. I will eventually get around to calibrating it to use it the way it is extended. Until then I am still 100% satisfied. I would recommend to anyone including good old Granny, she loves coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Keep it Clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to maintain! Here’s what I do! After I brew ,I empty the brew basket and rinse it under the faucet and dry with a paper towel. I then put in a paper filter or the reusable filter, wipe the little stainless steel plate and I’m ready for the next time. Keep the water tank and bean hopper full and you are all set! I love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: J. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: high tech solution to a low tech problem (not always a good thing)
customer_reviews.text: 1st one went south after about 10 months, chrome wheel jammed despite careful cleaning. Replaced under warranty, replacement lasted just over a year, got to where it would not recognize the correct amount of water put into it - full carafe sometimes registered 2-5 cups, often wouldn't even wake it up at all. Making coffee shouldn't have to be this complicated. Relative high price for a coffee maker that lasts about a year (cost me about a dollar a day just for the privilege of having it on my counter) - I have given up on this brand, gone back to something simpler - I guess I can relearn how to measure coffee with a scoop...
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Al

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrades
customer_reviews.text: Love the upgrade. We had an older version of this machine for a few years that died on us. Originally thought we’d change up machines but that was a bust. We came back to the Breville with grinder and I love the improvements made in this model. Also love that I can make a single cup as well as carafe. Enjoying this machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: La Vida

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: The Breville BDC650BSS Grind Control Coffee Maker, makes great coffee. I have searched for years to find a coffeemaker that makes great tasting coffee and have finally found it with this coffee maker. It is important to follow the instructions and clean all the parts after each brewing cycle. The convenience of the ability to switch from a carafe of 12 cups to a single brew cycle for one cup of coffee is excellent. In addition the one cup option offers a number of sizes. The strength adjustment takes the guess work out of how much coffee to add.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plan on cleaning the grinder out every couple days or it jams up and doesn't grind the beans
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in my purchase I should have listened to the reviews online. I use a French roast or dark roast Bean and the oils from the bean I believe plug the machine up about every other day and it's very difficult to clean and inconvenient to have to tear the whole thing apart. For the price I would expect a far better quality product. I've only had the unit 10 months and I'm looking for a new option. My previous grinder Brewer was a Cuisinart and I had it for years and it worked perfect. I should have saved half the price and bought one again
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the rest, this is hands-down, the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin? You have not lived until you have made coffee with this machine. It makes the best cup of coffee we've ever had... it doesn't compare to anything else. You just have to try it to see what I'm talking about. Yes, it is expensive. Yes, it is DEFINITELY worth every penny. Yes, you will purchase multiples to give to friends and family just so they can see what they have been missing their entire lives. Please do yourself a favor and go with this coffee maker. You will never regret it!
customer_reviews.author: A. M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Lot of work for little bang
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fuss for a so-so coffee maker. Unreliable with oily beans... clogs the pathway to the filter basket so you don't get a full load of grounds consistently each time. Requires constant cleaning of the grind pathway. The basket must be totally dry before reuse, so you almost need two if you want to make two pots. For $250 it's overkill ... I could have multiple others from fine makers for less... all more reliable. This was the first bad recommendation from Men's Journal in a long string.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The Jury is out
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is worth the money. Still trying to find the right combination of bean grind and strength. Cons are the unit seems inconsistent with brew sizes. If I brew 2 singe serve of 10 oz coffees one will be more than the other sometime as much as 1/2!! I would also like to have the ability to change the brew temperature. Seems that it cools too quickly even if I "pre-warm" the mug!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate with brewing volume
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my aging Breville Keurig machine. I underestimated how much more cleanup there is with this type of brewer. That's not really the fault of the machine though. What I don't like is it doesn't seem to accurately brew the amount of coffee it's supposed to. For example, brewing a 350ml single serving cup actually produces about 275ml-290ml of coffee. I would expect a little bit of liquid loss during brewing, but that seems excessive. I know there's a way to calibrate the amount of coffee ground, though I'm not sure if that will help with my issue or not.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Murray

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this at all. The grind feature does not work properly, the amount of grounds dispensed is not enough even on the strongest setting and the ground shoot gets clogged up daily requiring extensive maintenance. It would be faster to drive to Starbucks by the time you get a good cup of coffee. We have been trying to figure this coffee maker out for 45 days and now can’t even return it. For $250 we should be able to return within 1 year not 30 days. If anyone can help with the return/refund I would greatly appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L Thibodo

customer_reviews.title: breakdowns
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered three units in four years. coffee is great for small office but machine has mechanical problems often despite cleaning daily grinder broke on last unit and was replaced-died 3 weeks later new machine on the fritz after bought for Christmas HELP
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Second Breville machine
customer_reviews.text: If you like coffee, this is the machine for you. We got tired of replacing Keurig machines and dealing with the watered down flavor of most of the K-cup selections. Now we buy great Costa Rican beans at Marshal's and enjoy the best coffee imaginable every day. My only complaint is that the new LCD display makes it harder to see the water level, but it's a minor complaint and we've gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY T VENTRE

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would have expected from Breville and at the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third (and last) Breville I will own. Fortunately, the first two were exchanged under warranty. It makes a good cup of coffee but that, of course, depends more on the beans than the machine. It is, however, a serious nuisance to maintain. The coffee chute jams frequently requiring major disassembling to clean. The process takes about 15 minutes. In addition, the amount to be brewed changes at a whim usually when adding water.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Giere

customer_reviews.title: This fixed that problem-it makes great coffee that fits his high expectations
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, who is a coffee snob. He usually makes coffee in a complicated system of steps, including grinding, pouring precisely temperatured water over a specific weight of beans through various contraptions. Then we had a baby, and he stopped having enough time to do this. This fixed that problem-it makes great coffee that fits his high expectations.
customer_reviews.author: kimmypocket

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee every time.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this coffee maker. Stores at least 6oz of beans. I set it every night and get up to fresh brewed coffee. U can set the grind and strength. I used to strong coffee and this maker delivers it. I only have to set it on 3 to get the right strength.. can also compare with the Jura.
customer_reviews.author: cher

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months, now something jams or breaks every day
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I love it for 6 months, and now I am cleaning, tweaking, fixing something every day, many times wasting beans, and trying to figure out "what now" just to get a cup of coffee in the morning. I knew it wouldn't last forever, but only 6 months is very disappointing. Looking for a more reliable brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Audra

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee, Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: I originally reviewed this coffee pot at 5 starts but after 2.5 years, it just hasn't held up. There was a mysterious 'error 001' about 14 months after we purchased this coffee pot. Breville replaced it under warranty but now the new model is doing the same error and you can hear that the metal disk that closes off the grind chute is struggling to move. We have kept the machine meticulously clean, especially the coffee disk since that was the problem with the first unit. I would not recommend buying a coffee pot that costs as much as this one and does not last.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: everything it is marketed to be - excellent
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a quality coffee maker with embedded coffee grinder and a thermos container rather than burner to keep pot of coffee hot. This one was exactly what I wanted. Have had for several months now. No issues, works great, very happy with it. Features I like: Grinder does its job and is adjustable with turn of knob. Thermos keeps coffeee hot for 4hours (without preheating it with warm water). Easy to change number of cups, easy to switch to single cup and has lots room to put tall travel mug under dispenser. Love the preset feature which is also simple to set up. Top quality and works as advertised. Absolutely no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Absolutely positively perfect! I needed a machine that would grind beans and make a single cup of coffee at the touch of a button. I wanted to fill it with water and whole beans only periodically, not for every cup. I wanted to clean it periodically, not after every cho. I don't need steam or a frother. I refused to do kuerig cups (quality is bad, the cups are expensive and all the waste). This is for my office for my clients to have a single cup of coffee at the touch of a button. I have tried the $500-$1500 offerings of machines and they were too hard to use. This one is PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker combined with really good whole bean coffee & filtered water really provides me with that best cup of coffee! It's expensive & can be a pain cleaning after each use. It's something that we are willing to do for that elusive perfect cup of Joe. If you want a cup of coffee @ home like a coffee shop then this is the coffee maker for you!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sosebee

customer_reviews.title: Love this and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! So easy to use and clean up. I love waking up every morning, pushing the start button and in no more than 10minutes, my coffee is ready. I debated getting this item for a long time, and am extremely happy I eventually bought it. THe only challenging part to clean is the pot, thus the rating of a 4. I always stick a cloth in there to dry it because even though I put it on a drying rack, there is constantly residual water.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine is a complete waste of money. It took me some time to find the best grind setting to brew the strength of coffee I like, then the bean grinder started clogging repeatedly. It is a huge pain to disassemble the machine to unclog the grinder -- certainly not something I have time to do in the mornings before work, when this inevitably happens. Anyway, I'm tossing this thing and getting a Ninja. I will never buy anything under the Breville brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee....when it works.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this machine for about a month, we love coffee and we were over the moon excited about having the al in one option...for the first week. It makes great coffee when it works, the problem is, it doesn’t. It overflowed, we trouble shot it, brewers a pot- great! Problem fixed. Nope, overflowed again and repeat. We think we’ve got that under control and suddenly it starts grinding every last bean in the grinder no matter how we set it, and then, you guessed it overflows. The concept is great but the machine has created more frustration than coffee and nobody needs that
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Difficult cleaning points and too many points of failure
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning many times, coffee beans will not go into grinder after 3 months of use. Remember there is a super odd place to maintain on the front side of the unit, it's awkward to access and clean. Bean hopper does not hold that much. Thank God we kept the one it was replacing, a Cuisinart we've had for 5+ years that does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Futter

customer_reviews.title: just doesnt brew piping hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: the coffee maker design is great, but honestlt it only outputs coffee 150-160 degrees and when you add cold cream your coffee is just lukewarm. it is very disappointing. we have to go back to kureig now and we just dont want too :( oh and we had breville replace the coffee maker on warrenty it didnt really change much.
customer_reviews.author: KURUPDID

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, tasty, and unreliable.  Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: When this coffee maker works it makes nice coffee. Unfortunately, it is unreliable, the plastics gimp out after a year or so, and now it leaks water all over the counter every morning. The coffee pot lid is fragmenting and the carafe has a little side door that no longer snaps shut because the plastic has fatigued. The coffee chute now requires nightly manual cleaning or the coffee grounds don't pass through, whereas for the first 6 months I never needed to touch it. I've owned a few Breville small appliances. Breville makes beautiful pieces that look rock-solid and then die.
customer_reviews.author: TomatoTornado

customer_reviews.title: Far too much maintenance after brewing each pot.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this coffee maker for some time. It has gotten worse over time. The controls were OK and the burrs were marginally acceptable but the amount of cleaning and maintenance after each pot is excessive. There is more work with this machine than a separate grinder and French press. Needless to say, I’ll dismantle it one more time for cleaning then donate it - with a word of warning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee maker!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker and easy enough to use. I think most reviewers complaining just need to follow the instructions and accept this isn't a Keurig. A little more maintenance is required. I've had mine for over two years used daily without one single issue. Run hot water into the carafe to heat it up before making your coffee and it will still be warm, almost hot, 10 hours later. The grind control (hilariously off-putting name btw) feature plus strength selection is great to fine tune and make your coffee perfect to taste. I use different settings for various coffee types. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: J. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee but requires frequent cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Breville Grind Control Coffee Maker for about six weeks. It grinds and brews excellent coffee! My short experience so far tells me that the grinder/coffee chute requires more cleaning than the every 2 -3 weeks the manual suggests...i have needed to clean it every week to avoid blocking the coffee shoot. The cleaning of the grinder is also fairly involved as you have to take off a couple of pieces to get to the shoot opening and give the grinder a thorough brushing. For me, the high quality coffee makes this extra maintenance worth it, but someone unwilling to do this maybe should consider a more maintenance free machine. Great coffee though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: High maintenance!
customer_reviews.text: Multifunction machines are usually not good at everything and this is no exception. If you want fresh ground coffee, by a good grinder and a good brewing machine, not one machine that tries to do it all. This machine needs careful cleaning every day or two, or it will stop up and produce terrible coffee.
customer_reviews.author: WDM

customer_reviews.title: works, but shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: Great product, we replaced our older model with this newer one. Box was most likely dropped as the coffee filter housing lid was broken - unusable. Contacted Amazon who wanted us to ship entire coffee maker back & buy another one and wait 5-7 days for the credit. NOPE! just used the old coffee maker filter house. Will contact Breville and order a new filter housing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W Zelez

customer_reviews.title: Ok for warm coffee; pass if you like hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: Temperature of coffee is warm, not hot. Breville provides tips for hot coffee which essentially amounts to pre-heating the pot with boiling water. While that concept is understandable to retain heat longer and the same for any insulated container (Yeti cups, etc) the coffee straight out of the maker is not that hot to begin with. For as expensive as this maker is, I shouldn't have to boil a pot of water and let it preheat my pot before I make coffee every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good machine
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can use any coffee in the machine. I do wish that there was a gauge for coffee beans like there is for water. I like being able to brew a carafe and pour some in the middle of brewing without a mess. I also like being able to brew a cup for me and then a cup for my husband and have that auto brew. The only problem is I can’t make a full carafe. It spills everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace my Cuisinart grind & brew, which was a great coffee maker that lasted over 8 years (I guess this is acceptable life for a product these days) so far compared to the Cuisinart the fit & finish is far better, but the coffee has not been as strong. I have strength set to 8 and grind set to 3 and it's still a little bit weak (for me). That said it uses far less beans and still make a nice cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy from this seller. Quality bad and they don't honor full refund upon return.!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 Breville Grind and Brew in the last 4-5years and I know how this coffee maker should work. This seller's item doesn't work as expected. The beans don't flow through the hopper and get stuck after just using once or twice?!. You have to u a brush to push it through the hopper. When i returned to seller for refund due to quality not as expected, seller didn't provide full refund and deducted 20% off, adamant that their machine was working. I have video shot to prove but they didn't bother to verify with me and insisted machine working well. DO NOT buy from this vendor. It's their words against yours if the item is defective!!!
customer_reviews.author: KY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home or Small Office
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple months ago for use at work. There are 8 of us and this unit works perfectly. I read the negative reviews and they all seemed to focus on the cleaning aspect. Cleaning is barely more involved than a Mr Coffee and this thing makes GREAT coffee! I haven't been to Starbucks since. Great design, easy to use and a great value. 5 stars Update (1 year of use) - still running great. Used 5 days per week by 8+ people. We run 4-5 pots per day. It does require some regular cleaning as noted above but works very well. we started using paper filters and cleanup is much easier than the included basket. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Breville vs. Capresso
customer_reviews.text: Former Capresso owner. Loved my Capresso! The reviews on the newer models were not too good. After a lot of research, I pulled the trigger on this Breville. Very well made product. Solid. But.... the machine goes crazy on the amount of grinds. Too much and inconsistent. The clean up was a little too much also.Various adjustments seemed to have little effect. Taste of coffee also seemed strange. Needless to say, I returned this unit and purchased the Capresso. Better performance and improved taste. Easier clean up also.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn  Rick

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Good coffee finally!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny!! We are using it in our office and it just a breeze to use it. We all like it and would buy another one. The only thing ppl sometimes complain about is the grinder noise but any grinder makes noise no matter what. The grinder is done in 5 seconds and we generally leave it on auto so when we get to the office in the morning coffee is already brewed so it’s not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently stops grinding
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in November of last year and it already intermittently stops grinding, even after it has been thoroughly cleaned. Had the previous model for years and never had issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but messy cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Really good cup of coffee. Grinder works. But always seems to get a lot of grounds in the cup. We use pre ground coffee and paper filters and the coffee is amazing. But manual cleanup after each cup is messy and it always seems to leave a pool of water in with the filter. So messy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: DF_EE

customer_reviews.title: Bad grinder design. Doesn’t work like prior model.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Breville Grind and Brew. My first lasted 10 years and I loved it. This one, not so much. The new ones grinder clogs every 3-4 days and I end up with hot water instead of coffee. The process to clean and clear the grinder is messy and time consuming. I really wish I hadn’t purchased this expensive unit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best grind and brew ever!
customer_reviews.text: It took me 3 days to be comfortable with it, but it turns out that it works so much better than my discontinued Cuisinart 900. I went through 3 of them in 7 years. I bought a warranty on this one. It even looks sexy sitting on my counter. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Not for strong coffee
customer_reviews.text: It probably brews a great cup of regular coffee but if you like strong coffee (dark roast)... move on... you can't regulate the bean to cup ratio so it always tries to outsmart you and therefore, you end up with light to medium brown coffee not a rich strong dark coffee. Making that distinction because it might work for many but if you want strong coffee, there are other models out there and less expensive...
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different item!
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t last a year and we only make a half a pot of coffee a day. The grinder broke and it’s got a lot of parts and things to clean every day that make it complicated and unreliable. On the rare times I set it for a full pot it overflowed frequently. Note / if you buy it here you have 30’days to return and the warranty from breville is a year. Mine died one week after the year expired. I had grinder problems one other time about 6 months in that were solved by cleaning it but it just died.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Good single cup, not hot when a pot.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product. It makes lovely coffee when making one cup, but when a carafe is needed the coffee is never hot to our liking. A K-cup device does the same thing at a much lower price. I cannot recommend. Breville was prompt with responses concerning the product but cannot offer an alternative for hotter coffee. If they carafe had a heating element it would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Grinding not Great Brewing failed
customer_reviews.text: Started off OK, but grinding feature has not produced strong enough coffee. It appears the beans are not getting through the chute fast enough. Plus clogging is common. Disappointed. Update: The entire brew operation, without grind, failed. The coffee maker no longer heats water nor counts down a brew cycle. This product was expensive, but lasted less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Reddy Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best. Coffee. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: After years of trying the latest and greatest, this Breville machine is like finding the Holy Grail. We've tried techivorm, pour overs, burr grinders, everything, but the Breville puts it all into on neat package that's easy to use, with nifty features that actually make sense. We got this machine after being treated to coffee at our neighbors--they swear by it and say it's their go-to wedding gift. They have had theirs for several years of heavy use--no issues. You will love the thoughtful design, easy cleaning and best coffee you can make at home.
customer_reviews.author: InjaGirl

product_meta.title: Breville BDC650BSS Grind Control Coffee Maker, Brushed Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Contains stainless steel blurs, bean hopper has a locking system for easy removal, storage and transfer. In case of the coffee basket dripping or other issues , please do the following to minimize it . After each use, wash the coffee basket, taking particular care to rinse the chute area. Dry thoroughly (especially the chute area). Ensure there are no grinds in the coffee basket before lining the coffee basket with the Gold tone or paper filter and in case of carafe overflowing issue , please ensure that the carafe is Completely empty before the start of the brewing. Voltage 110–120 Volts.
feature_bullets: 8 Strength Settings: Choose from 8 strength settings or choose Pre Ground coffee option to brew coffee just the way you like it and bean hopper capacity is 1/2 pound of Coffee bean capacity with locking system for easy removal, storage and transfer

Brewing Capacity: Single cup with variable size options or upto a 12 cup carafe; Dimensions:9 inch (W) X 14 inch (D) X 16 & ¼ inch (H); 1/2 pounds of Coffee bean capacity with locking system for easy removal, storage and transfer
Removable drip tray for 7.5 inch height clearance to fit tall cups and travel mugs; if Carafe overflows: Always ensure the carafe is completely empty before brewing. Power:1100 Watts
LCD Screen: Provides real time feedback on water level, grind size, strength selection, grinding time, brewing time, and selected settings
Programmable Auto Start: Automatically starts grinding and then brewing coffee at your selected time; Pre brew temperature control: Delivers water at the ideal temperature from cold start
Note: This product is not compatible with demineralized water such as distilled or reverse osmosis water; Construction Materials: Stainless Steel; Water tank capacity: 60 ounces
